Disc chip question
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Items: Disc chip question
By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, February 27, 2001 - 05:18 am:

in chat last night, a question came up, and i wasn't sure of the answer.

can you get disc chips for a breed that you haven't unlocked?

any help would be appreciated. thanx

By DiskCatcher on Tuesday, February 27, 2001 - 04:21 pm:

I never got barjarl chips until I got barjarl.

By ABB4Life on Wednesday, February 28, 2001 - 06:49 pm:

I never ever got any disc chips for monsters that were not unlocked...then, once I unlocked a monster, I would begin to see their disc chips all over the place in expeditions. So from my experience, it seems you must unlock a monster type in order to find disc chips for that monster type. I'm interested in seeing other responses to this one.

A-B-B

By PezCat on Wednesday, February 28, 2001 - 07:21 pm:

I don't think so. I never got Bajarl before
unlocking it, never got Joker or Beaclon before
unlocking, etc.

However, I did get Golem and Baku before
unlocking the subs for those ones. I think that
you can get disc chips in the same way as you
can get the sub-breeds for a few locked
monsters. i.e., since you can get the
sub-breeds of Gali, Henger, Worm, Mew,
Dragon, Golem and Baku from the beginning,
you can therefore get their disc chips.

And yes, I know that Mew isn't a usable sub.
: (

PezCat

By Eagle Fierce on Wednesday, February 28, 2001 - 11:30 pm:

I've found Ducken chips before, and I'm pretty sure that I've never raised a Ducken on a save. The same with Wracky, but I finally did raise on of those (pretty good, too! 800s in everything but skill which was 450 :D).

By torey_luvullo on Thursday, March 1, 2001 - 05:35 am:

but as long as you have unlocked ducken, it is available - even tho you havent raised it.

By Jello on Thursday, March 1, 2001 - 02:45 pm:

up before?

By Eagle Fierce on Thursday, March 1, 2001 - 05:13 pm:

There are three possibilities here:

A.) One can get them at any time with the right amount of luck (my personal belief)

B.) One gets them once you obtain the items for unlocking (I.E. "Double-Edge," "Magic Pot," "Strong Glue") without necessarily unlocking the creature.

C.) One gets them only after having created the monster and/or raised the breed.

For what you say to be true, Torey, it'd have to be the second one, because the only time I even created a Ducken was to unlock disc stones. I'll raise one someday, yes, but right now all that I have is the "Strong Glue" and the Ducken Doll (forgot the name).

What I meant by I THINK I have gotten them is that shortly before Christmas, the save ports on my original PSX got fried, and I just played around raising this and that because it didn't matter once I hit the power button. This may have been when I encountered the chips, but I'm 99% certain that I've gotten them on my saved games.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 03:44 pm:

I have never been able to get some types of chips (read: the locked monster chips) without first unlocking said monster. Now, this might be pure chance, but I have a feeling that it's related. While I've never raised a tiger, and still regularly get tiger chips, I never once got hold of a Bajarl dick chip until I bred that first Bajarl. Now, I can't seem to get away from them. Same with Mock chips, on the Torles Mountain Expedition.

By torey_luvullo on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 06:25 pm:

it looks like my memory is faulty, and i will have to unlock beaclon before i can get beaclon chips. thanx, everyone!
